pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:5.1: 13. The training rule on loud noises
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were being noisy while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:7.2: “‘I will not be noisy while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not be noisy.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes loud noises while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:9.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:10.1: The third training rule is finished.
